subject: RE: [junit] gui testing
msgSnippet: ... That notwithstanding, you still need to test the connection between the mediator and your GUI. There s still plenty of room for error there.
messageBody:
Bob Koss [mailto:koss@...] wrote:
> But if we use Mediator to decouple the gui controls, we may as
> well delegate
> everything to the Mediator and leave the gui stupid. The Mediator can be
> unit tested just like any other class, and doesn't need the gui since all
> communication is done through interfaces.

That notwithstanding, you still need to test the connection between the
mediator and your GUI. There's still plenty of room for error there.

^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Mike Silverstein
SilverMark, Inc.
The object testing company
http://www.javatesting.com
